snippet: There were signs of a willingness to consider something less than a direct path to citizenship for all the estimated 11.7 million immigrants in the country illegally.
abstract: Immigrant youth leaders gathered in Washington, DC, signal that they may be willing to consider supporting a Republican compromise proposal that would offer path to citizenship for young people but not for other illegal immigrants; move stems in part from growing frustration with Democrats while deportations under Obama administration continue.
lead_paragraph: There were signs of a willingness to consider something less than a direct path to citizenship for all the estimated 11.7 million immigrants in the country illegally.

headline.main: Immigrant Youth Leaders Signal They May Be Open to a G.O.P. Compromise
headline.print_headline: Immigrant Youth Leaders Signal They May Be Open to a G.O.P. Compromise

keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)
keywords.name: subject
